New Records: Shohei Ohtani hit the fastest pitch recorded in MLB history during the game.
Mookie Betts and Freddie Freeman each hit home runs in the first inning, setting a new record for the Dodgers.
Ben Casparius achieved a win in his debut, marking a new milestone for the Dodgers' pitching staff.
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani's inside-the-park home run in the bottom of the 1st inning.
Mookie Betts' home run in the first inning tied a franchise record.
Tommy Edman's walk-off single in the bottom of the 9th inning, securing the Dodgers' victory.
Pre-Game Insights: Analysts predicted a close game between the two teams with high run potential.
The Dodgers' bullpen was expected to play a crucial role in the late innings.
Post-Match Reflections: Dodgers' manager Dave Roberts praised the team's resilience after the comeback win.
The victory was highlighted as a pivotal moment in the Dodgers' playoff push.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played under clear skies at Chase Field with a temperature of 78 degrees.
The attendance was 50,041, marking a strong fan presence.
Others: The Dodgers' win extended their lead in the NL West division.
